evidence.text:
Person B: Do you have something for me?
Person A: Voluntary manslaughter, with a recommendation of 20 years - 15 to serve, followed by 5 on probation. Standard conditions.
Person A: I’ll even waive the recidivist statute, if he pleads before we strike the jury.
Person B: And admit to something he didn't do...?
Person A: Save that for the jury. Or better yet, plead your guy out and go back to your three-figure caseload.
Person B: My client wants a trial.
Person A: Then you're wasting my time. And your "client's."

Person A: He beat her viciously, pushed her over a railing -- into the creek below -- and left her to die.
Person B: James Sythe didn't attack her and couldn't have pushed her. Because he wasn't there.
Person A: James Sythe took an innocent life!

Person A: You were his favorite student. And now you're a...
Person B: A what?
Person A: A politican.
Person B: You saw him walk down Old Quarry Road?

Person B: An eyewitness saw him at the crime scene AT the time of death.
Person B: When she broke up with him that night, and he realized she meant it, he snapped. And so he bludgeoned her.
Person B: The defendant's DNA was found all over the victim. No one else's.
Person B: Until they weren't.
Person B: That person is James Sythe.
Person B: Find him guilty.

Person A: What can I tell you? They're taking their job seriously. I gave them a lot to think about.
Person B: I've got a mountain of evidence. You gave them smoke and mirrors.
Person B: "Our resources are already stretched so thin?" You are something.
Person A: So, I’m right. You have doubt.
Person A: You know something isn’t right here, hell, even the jury knows it.

Person B: Well, you did it. Hope it was worth it.
Person B: Ale House later. You're buying.
